poem:
### Turning a Corner

The numbers whisper,
headlines buzz and flicker –
UK stands tall, its shadow
casts beyond Rome, Tokyo,
Berlin – a paper fortress,
rising on the optimism
of economists who dream
of swift recoveries, sweeping
up the dust of yesterday,
binding futures to forecast,
like sails to capricious wind.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
